p: Energy is a fundamental component of continuous economic growth in any country. In Australia, total energy consumption increased by 44.5% from 56,651 ktoe (kilotons of oil equivalent) to 81,843 ktoe between 1990 and 2017 (IEA, 2020). However, the country’s energy production increased by 47.5% from 86,139 to 127,032 ktoe in the same period (IEA, 2020). Therefore, Australia is one of the few members in the OECD that is an energy exporter (EIA, 2020). In 2015, the country was the leading coal exporter and second-largest liquefied natural gas (LNG) exporter in the world (EIA, 2020).
